definition: as close as one's hands and feet (idiom); loving one another as brothers/deep friendship/closely attached to one another
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: Those two comrades are hand -in-glove with each other.
Thailand and China enjoy brotherly relations and are sincere friends sharing weal and woe.
sentences.chinese: 泰中两国情同手足，是患难之交和真诚的朋友。

sentences.english: So fervent still was the sisterly interest I felt in Mr. Godfrey.
sentences.chinese: 我对高孚利先生那种情同手足的关心是至深且巨的。

sentences.english: Heller took war as his subject, but he didn't write about backslapping brothers in arms.
sentences.chinese: 海勒虽喜战争题材，但不写军队里情同手足的兄弟。

definition: as close as brothers (idiom); deep friendship
a friend in times of tribulations (idiom); a friend in need is a friend indeed
to treat one another with absolute sincerity (idiom); to show total devotion
close relation, no gap (idiom); intimate and nothing can come between
feelings deeper than for one's own flesh and blood (idiom)/deep friendship
To enjoy blessings and endure misfortune together (idiom); for better or for worse
pinyin: you3 fu2 tong2 xiang3 , you3 nan4 tong2 dang1

definition: as close as flesh and bones (idiom); deep friendship
to become sworn brothers or sisters/sworn (brothers)
